summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Michael Danchuk, transmitting the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement and instructing that its disclosure be restricted to those who have signed a Protective Order. It highlights the confidential handling of the agreement.

persons.name: Michael Danchuk
persons.role: Recipient of the email and Non-Prosecution Agreement
persons.context: The email is addressed to him, and the sender states they will pass on greetings to him. He is instructed to restrict disclosure of the attached agreement.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender, whose name is not fully provided, attaches the Non-Prosecution Agreement and gives instructions regarding its confidential handling and the Protective Order.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is sending confidential legal documents (the Non-Prosecution Agreement) to Michael Danchuk with specific handling instructions.

events.title: Transmission of Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Michael Danchuk, attaching the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement and instructing him to restrict its disclosure to those who have signed a Protective Order.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement was transmitted via email on December 5, 2008.
Disclosure of the agreement was to be restricted only to individuals who had reviewed and signed a Protective Order.
The correspondence indicates a high level of confidentiality surrounding the handling of the non-prosecution agreement.
